paper_abstract: B2B e-marketplaces alter the structure of buyer-seller trading networks. To study the network-level structural changes caused by the emergence of e-marketplaces, we develop a multiple-player noncooperative game. where rational firms select optimal interfirm connections and the network is endogenously formed and evolved. We examine the conditions under which both neutral and biased B2B e-markets will sustain, when previous buyer-seller connections exist. We test our model in both the oligopoly market and the oligopsony market. Our analysis explains how ownership structures and market competition interact with each other to affect e-market sustainability. We also identify other critical factors for sustainable e-markets and their social welfare implications. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The sustainability of B2B e-marketplaces: Ownership structure, market competition, and prior buyer-seller connections
